metadata.name: session_8692
metadata.description: Tutoring session for: Susan reads a book at a rate of 1 page every 3 minutes. If her reading rate remains the same, which ...

conversation.content:
To find the number of minutes for Susan to read 18 pages, I think we can use a proportion or a multiplication method since her reading rate remains the same.

We know that Susan reads 1 page every 3 minutes. To find the time it takes to read 18 pages, we can multiply the time it takes to read 1 page by 18.

So, the calculation would be: 3 minutes/page * 18 pages = ?

I'm not sure if this is the correct method, but it seems logical to me. Is this the right approach?
You're on the right track! Multiplying the time per page by the number of pages is indeed a valid method. Can you complete the calculation?

I'll complete the calculation.

3 minutes/page * 18 pages = 54 minutes

So, it would take Susan 54 minutes to read 18 pages.

FINAL: 54 minutes
Great job! You correctly determined that Susan would take 54 minutes to read 18 pages by multiplying her reading rate by the number of pages. Well done!
